title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toledo
Interview Descriptions: Easy online. Apply online. Drug testing. Multiple part interview with multiple people. I do not have anything else to say about this question to be honest. This is all really easy
Interview Questions: I can not remember this

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toledo
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back and informal. They were really just trying to get a good idea as to how I interacted with others and why I was so passionate about sharing my love for the university with incoming students.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an orientation leader, what is your favorite part of being a student here, tell us your favorite memory from being at Toledo, what is your involvement on campus

title: IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Phone and face to face interview. Questioned on what computer skills and how good in communication. It took about 2 weeks to finish the process. why does this have to be minimum 30 words
Interview Questions: any computer skills, any experience in customer service

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Sit down in an office asked a few questions, it was real laid back, I was in my scrubs, I had my resume ready,I was confident, she was friendly, it was one on one,
Interview Questions: Tell a little about yourself

title: Research Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Mine was during beginning of COVID, so I had a zoom call. Pretty easy. Asked me “tell me about a time when you…” questions and asked about my experience. Overall, the questions were very standard. I believe they asked me to describe the cell line process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond in your job.

title: Finance Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: They scheduled the first time interview. There were 5 people to interview me with a few pages questions.  Then if you passed the 1st interview then they will call you and schedule the 2nd interview.
Interview Questions:
What do you know about UT?
Why you want to work at UT.
Excel questions.
Basic accounting questions.

title: IT Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Toledo
Interview Descriptions: It was okay. There were 3-4 people asking questions. The interview process was smooth and most of the question were technical and about past experiences. Not many difficult questions but they were thorough about your previous experience
Interview Questions: What are your biggest strenghts and weaknesses

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Toledo in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy. I went into the office and spoke with the hiring manager about why I wanted to work and what my hours would be. I would highly suggest getting a student worker job while in college.
Interview Questions: Why did I want the job.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very to the point and informative of what is expected. They were pleasant and made me feel  comfortable to be myself.  The over all experience was positive. I would apply again.
Interview Questions: Are you able adapt well in a fast paced work environment?

title: Rocket Patrol Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Apply on Handshake, got a phone call, required fingerprinting and a basic background check. It was about three days before I heard back for an interview and then another couple to get my finger prints and a background check.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toledo
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is a multi-stage process for hiring new employees. The interview process typically includes the following steps: writing a job description, posting a job, scheduling interviews, conducting preliminary interviews, conducting in-person interviews, following up with candidates, and making a hire.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions:
apply it online or in person 
submit resume 
will receive phone call when they want to have interview 
meeting with the director 
will ask you what skills and how many language you speak 
they will tell you their decision
Interview Questions:
why do you apply this position? 
How many language do you speak? 
How many hours you willing to work?

title: Enrollment Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Great and easy going. Very comfortable. Easy to understand the process. Great place to interview. Very easy to find. Campus is pretty. Business casual. HR process was a breeze and comfortable to talk with. Contacted back quick.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH)
Interview Descriptions:
I feel that the process took to long. From interviewing to receiving an offer.
Not detailed and rushed through process.
Training was not appropriate for what was expected. Not quite what I expected or needed in appreciate training
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a different co-worker?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: After contacting with my adviser through email, he showed interest about my experience and asked some questions related to my previous work. After replying that email, he set a time for phone interview. After that, he recommend me to apply at University of Toledo and helped me to get graduate assistantship.
Interview Questions: Why do you choose this university?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough. They asked a lot about hypothetical situations and how you would react to them. There was a lot of "explain a time when this happened and how did it affect you and how did you respond to it."
Interview Questions: What is an example of a situation where you had to be unbiased?

title: Mathematics Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH)
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an application, which included three references. I was then contacted for an interview. The interview mainly consisted of solving math problems and explaining how I solved them.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a tutor?

title: Assistant Research Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview was with phone and then campus visit. It was very smooth and friendly environment. The position was for a very specific field. I did not have to present my previous work.
Interview Questions: how much is your salary expectation?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very informal and easy interview process. It was really more just of a test to make sure you would fit in with the lab and could communicate at least reasonably well. Since you're already accepted to the school, the interview process is very minimal.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions were asked

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toledo
Interview Descriptions: I applied to graduate school online. Sent them all the required documents via mail. After they received the documents they started to review them. Based on my previous education records and experiences they offered me a position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a very laid back interview. Two people interviewed me and read questions from a sheet and then had a brief personal conversation. Human resources took a very long time after my interview to get me officially hired in. It was also contingent on a drug screen as well as background check and reference check. They really look into your past work experience, so be truthful.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Medicinal Chemistry Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online in Jan 2016 and received an email for a skype interview in Feb 2016.  The whole interview took 10 mins. Five to Six faculties took turn asking questions about preview my previous research experience.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous research experience.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Short interview regarding your capabilities and grades. It was a short interview and normally they have a copy of your resume so it is easy to further explain the qualifications.
Interview Questions: What are you prior skills?

title: Media Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview which included traditional, behavioral and situational questions. I had not had a job interview in over 30 years. So though I tried to prepare, I really was not entirely ready.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you needed a quote from a professor and he/she was unwilling to provide it for a publication?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Toledo
Interview Descriptions: Was a phone interview. Pretty basic questions. They were friendly during the interview. The follow up was quick as well. Should have explained in detail the benefits and the kind of work expected. Focus was on the statement of purpose.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this university?

title: College Computing Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toledo in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I was interviewed by a selection team of 5 department members initially, who covered my resume and asked for details of career experience. I then interviewed with two managers in a follow-up interview.

After two interviews, I was told to expect an answer within a week. I never got any answer, no feedback and no response from e-mails or calls (all polite and not naggy).
Interview Questions: Explain a situation where you had to deal with an upset customer.

title: Information Technology Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by email about opportunity, and then wen tin for interview, was asked general easy questions about myself and what I like to do. Received a call later that day with an offer, and when I wanted to start.
Interview Questions: When I wanted to work?

title: Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: It consisted of driving a bit. I did not really like having to drive their vehicle and be tested on my driving skills because it was not my vehicle and did not really show my best abilities when it came to my driving skills.
Interview Questions: Do you have your license?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was asked to teach a captive class (consisting of undergrads, grads,and faculty) for 30 minutes. Any subject of my choice. Then a one-on-one session with each faculty in the department, followed by dinner at a nearly restaurant. Pleasant and stress-free interview.
Interview Questions: All questions were related to the topic I chose to each my captive audience.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toledo
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the university website with submitting my transcript and resume, it took few months for the review of application and I got the research assistant scholarship after the application process was done.
Interview Questions: Submit my Undergraduate transcripts along with my resume, work experience projects, GRE score, TOEFL score and I got the research assistant scholarship after the application process was done.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Toledo
Interview Descriptions: They called me back after reviewing my resume and asked me to come in for an interview.  I came in and interview directly with my reporting supervisor, in a one on one setting.  They explained the duties and asked if i had any questions.  The current assistant showed me around the office and some basic tasks that i would be completing.
Interview Questions: Asked my skill set around the office, basic STAR method behavior question model as well.

title: Marketing & Recruitment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: The job was posted online, and the resume, cover letter and references were submitted online. Two days after the application closed, I received a call inviting me to an interview for two business days later. After confirming my appointment time, I received an emaik with interview details such as location, interviewers and homework. I brought six copies of a writing sample as well as markups of the first proof of a design project.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time your concept of diversity was challenged.

title: IT Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was easy going and laid back, a drug test was required at UTMC also. the actual interview went fast they just needed to know basic skills and qualifications and there was a lot of joking and laughter so you i was not nervous. Maybe its because I was a student worker but it seemed very simple glad i came in
Interview Questions: What would you do if a customer yelled at you

title: Department Chair Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: 1 phone interview, one on site interview, very slow committee process.  Took 4 months from first phone interview to offer.   Face to face interview was a full day affair, starting at 9 am and ending with dinner.
Interview Questions: Pepsi or Coke

title: Assistant Director of Career Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone and in-person interviews. Was given an offer before I even made it back home from the interview. Had to prepare and give a presentation within a 24 hour time frame. Presented to a panel of roughly 6 interviewers. A little intimidating but in reality the hiring "manager" was incredibly unprofessional. Very pushy and rude when going through the hiring process.
Interview Questions: Very behavioral in nature. A lot of "tell me about a time when..."

title: Residence Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview was basic with scripted questions they continued to use even after I already answered them in my responses. The last part of the day was on a separate part of campus. I was driven there in an open air golf cart in the rain. The staff member driving laughed as I almost fell out and tried in vain to keep my suit dry.
Interview Questions: How do you work with diverse students?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Toledo
Interview Descriptions: Submit my transcripts from college, GRE score, my resume, then I just wait. About 2 months later, I got an offer by email saying that I was given a scholarship.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Toledo
Interview Descriptions: I have seen the advertisement and send the email with my CV. After a couple of weeks I was asked to send reference. Then I got a interview after one months. I was asked to give a talk in the department.  I met the future boss and colleagues. The boss will ask some questions.
Interview Questions: How do you demonstrate that you are good at this position?

title: Tech Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH)
Interview Descriptions: After I submitted my resume, I received a telephone call to schedule an interview. I was asked some basic questions about computers, and work availability. After the Interview I received an email asking if I wanted to accept the postion
Interview Questions: How do you display a MAC address on a windows machine.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: If you are a graduate student at the University of Toledo, you apply online for the available positions and when you get an interview call and then get to have your face to face interview.
Interview Questions: About your background and capabilities.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Quick and straightforward, approached different professors with my resume. Got an email from a professor for a personal meeting. Attended meeting then a review of my resume. He/she went through all my details in it, asked questions regarding my works.
Interview Questions: What areas of robotics did you work on?

title: Floor Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions:
3 rounds of interviewing process 
5 people interviewed you in a room 
have to make it through each phase 
2 weeks was the whole process
500 people applied for the position
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths, and weaknesses 
What are your experiences

title: IT Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview to start. Very easy and straight to the point. Have some background of OS and Computers. They want to make sure they get to know you on a personal level and you are able to interact with students and staff.
Interview Questions: There was no technical test. They want to get to know you on a personal level.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at University of Toledo
Interview Descriptions: You can talk to professors to get a research assistant position, which would be good for your academic career. You can talk the dean or department chair to get a graduate assistant position. But whether you can get it mostly depends on who your advisor is.
Interview Questions: What is your research experience?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was really simple. I got a phone call and had very basic interview questions. Than they asked me to come down for a face to face interview. It was pretty easy as well. after that they gave me a lab tour and offered me a position within 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: What do you expect to learn here in the university

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I started work as a volunteer and later was paid as an hourly Intern. I really appreciate   the management given me the opportunities to learn and earn. I think the "free internship" for all pharmacist student should be abolished as pharmacist student has to paid a much higher tuition than other majors, and working for free has added burden to the student as no income and not able to work for other job due to no more free time avaiable.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very professional and it took not that long, mainly talked with the Chairman and he would decide which professor you would be assisting with and which classes you should help with.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have in order to be a good Graduate Assistant?

title: Clerical Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Submit application come to office with birth certificate, social security card, state Id, work study contract papers.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Public Records Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied on-line and received a phone call within three weeks.  I did a phone interview, skype interview, and in-person interview.  I received a phone call within a week letting me know I was not selected for the position.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you faced a challenge within your organization and how you overcame it.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Met the department chair for the decision and then met the HR people for the paper work and benefits. It is a quite simple process. If you have some people recommend you to the department chair, and your are a qualified teacher with some experience, the interview is very easy. The interview is short and informal actually, but the key thing is you are a good teacher.
Interview Questions: Teaching experience?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Toledo in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: I sent all the necessary document to the university. the department also requested for my transcript which i submitted. By mid October I have submitted all the necessary document. I even called them to make sure they had them. They reviewed my document  and gave me admission by mid February with assistanship,
Interview Questions: I wasn't interviewed they just reviewed my document and made a decision based on that.

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Toledo in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was hired at the last minute and over the phone. The process was very collegial and the questions were in parallel with the job requirements and discipline. I really felt as if the administration was very well prepared to interview me and that they took the time to review my CV and CL.
Interview Questions: What contribution can you make to the department?

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Toledo (Toledo, OH) in Nov 2008
Interview Descriptions: It was all about connections really. There were no real questions in the interview.
Interview Questions: Which hours can you work?
